conclusion: Determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into by following the flow paths from A, B, C, and D.
Yellow liquid starts at point A.
Yellow liquid flows through the red and green bars, then past the gray bar.
Yellow liquid ends up flowing towards the left side and into container E.
Cyan liquid starts at point B.
Cyan liquid flows through the red bar and down past the white bar.
Cyan liquid merges with some pink liquid and flows into container E.
Pink liquid starts at point C.
Pink liquid flows through the gray bar and merges with the cyan liquid.
Pink liquid ends up flowing into container E.
Blue liquid starts at point D.
Blue liquid flows through the pink bar and then the black bar.
Blue liquid merges with the other liquids and flows into container E.
From the key illustration, all liquids merge and flow into container E.
The liquid will flow into container E.
